ARABIC: قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِ أَن نَّأْخُذَ إِلَّا مَن وَجَدْنَا مَتَٰعَنَا عِندَهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذًا لَّظَٰلِمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: He said, 'Allah forbid that we should take anyone but him with whom our goods were found. In that case we would clearly be wrongdoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: May God forgive us," he said, "if we hold any one but him with whom we found our property, or else we would be unjust."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Joseph said: "Allah forbid that we should seize any except him with whom we found our good. Were we to do so, we would surely be one of the wrong-doers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He replied, "God forbid! How could I take someone in place of the thief? In doing so I would be committing injustice."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: He said, “The refuge of Allah from that we should take anyone except him with whom our property was found – we would then surely be unjust.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "Allah forbid, that we should take anyone but him with whom we found our property. Indeed (if we did so), we should be wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Allah protect us that we should seize other than him with whom we found our property, for then most surely we would be unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'God forbid that we should take any other but him in whose possession we found the goods; for if we did so, we would be evildoers.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He replied, "God forbid that we should take anyone other than the person on whom we found our property. In that case, we would clearly be wrongdoers."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: He said: Allah forbid that we should take anyone but him with whom we found our stuff; verily then we should be the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘God forbid that we should detain anyone except him with whom we found our wares, for then we would indeed be wrongdoers.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: He said: "Allah forbid that we take other than him with whom we found our property: indeed (if we did so), we should be acting wrongfully.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: He said: "Allah forbid, that we should take anyone but him with whom we found our property. Indeed (if we did so), we should be Zalimun (wrong-doers)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: He replied: 'Allah forbid that we should seize any but he with whom our property was found, for then we should be harmdoers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “God forbid that we should arrest anyone except him in whose possession we found our property; for then we would be unjust.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: He said, "[I seek] the refuge of Allah [to prevent] that we take except him with whom we found our possession. Indeed, we would then be unjust."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:79] He said, ‘God forbid (ma‘ādha’Llāhi, [lit.] ‘refuge is with God’, is in the accusative because it is a verbal noun, the verb having been omitted and placed in a genitive annexation with its direct object, in other words, [understand it as] na‘ūdhu bi’Llāhi, ‘we seek refuge with God’) that we should take anyone save him with whom we found our property — he did not say ‘[save] him who stole [our property]’, being careful not to lie; for then truly — if we were to take anyone other than him — we would be evildoers’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (He said) Joseph said to them: (Allah forbid that we should seize) for the crime of theft (save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers) by arresting someone with whom we did not find our property.
